cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi NW of Great Inagua Island, 340 mi SE of Nassau
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest through the Bahamas, then turning north-northwest to parallel/brush the Florida east coast before recurving northeastward along the U.S. Atlantic seaboard toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Possibly along the east-central Florida coast or just inland over the Carolinas (exact point still uncertain)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch posted only for Florida east coast from Ocean Reef to Sebastian Inlet; no Mid-Atlantic watch yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-Storm Warnings confined to the Bahamas at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida through the Carolinas to New England lies within the 5-day cone
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (2–4 inches likely; isolated totals could exceed 4 inches)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (minor tidal surge possible in upper Chesapeake Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≈3%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25–40 mph possible Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding of 1–2 ft above normal tides possible in the Chesapeake Bay and tidal Patapsco River
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Monday night–Tuesday with 2–4 inches, localized higher amounts, producing urban/stream flooding risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; hazardous seas for shipping on approaches to the Chesapeake
